intro: Dunalia tubulosa, commonly known as the tubular dunalia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and showy, tubular-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to purple. Its leaves are typically alternate and ovate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Dunalia tubulosa is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
